pullRequest.body:
This PR should provide some necessary constructions to use colimits on the Grothendieck construction as a replacement for double colimits with an inner shape that depends on the outer index.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

:v: javra can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Thanks!
bors d+

Thanks!
bors d+

```suggestion
/-- Every morphism `f : X âŸ¶ Y` in the base category induces a natural transformation from the fiber
```

`Grothendieck.coherence` and `colimit.Î¹_eq_eqToHom_comp_Î¹` should probably be placed in different files. `#find_home!` suggests `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Grothendieck` for the former and `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Limits.HasLimits` for the latter.

I also wonder whether the direction of `colimit.Î¹_eq_eqToHom_comp_Î¹` should be reversed (and it should probably be tagged `@[reassoc]`).
Ah yes, the current state is that I didn't really know whether they deserved to be more than private auxiliary lemmas. Are they really?
This looks to me like it could be an `instance`?
This should be dualized.

Is there a reason why you didn't just do
```suggestion
instance hasColimitsOfShapeGrothendieck [âˆ€ X, HasColimitsOfShape (F.obj X) H]
```
here?
Probably because the linter gave me the "... is a def, should be a lemma/theorem" error
Ah, I see. There is a fix coming in core for this. Until then, your solution is a good workaround.

`fiberwiseColimit` is tagged `@[simps]`, so it will potentially unfold to `colimit (Grothendieck.Î¹ F X â‹™ G)`. But it seems to me that this will be potentially problematic for users because they cannot mention in `colimit (Grothendieck.Î¹ F X â‹™ G)` in things like `have` statements because you have made the `hasColimitFiber` lemma private.

Unrelatedly, the naming convention suggests something like `Grothendieck.hasColimit_Î¹_comp`.

```suggestion
lemma hasColimit_fiberwiseColimit [HasColimit G] : HasColimit (fiberwiseColimit G) where
```

```suggestion
def coconeOfCoconeFiberwiseColimit (c : Cocone (fiberwiseColimit G)) : Cocone G where
```

```suggestion
lemma hasColimit_of_hasColimit_fiberwiseColimit_of_hasColimit : HasColimit G where
```
or something

```suggestion
theorem hasColimitsOfShape_grothendieck [âˆ€ X, HasColimitsOfShape (F.obj X) H]
```

```suggestion
theorem limit.Ï€_comp_eqToHom (F : J â¥¤ C) [HasLimit F] {j j' : J} (hj : j = j') :
```

```suggestion
```
